now I spoke with a few members of this

excited about it and I got a little
insight into the creative process of
this record the writing and the

essentially telling me that a lot of

improvisation jams that they were doing
together either just straight
improvisation or just kind of ideas

knowing that understanding that I was

very like I said tense it's repetitive
its redundant in a way it's hypnotic
it's like dope body is just taking this
one idea and trying to string it out as

jumping back and forth between these two
guitar variations to kind of give the
the song some contrast and in some sense
of verse-chorus verse-chorus or whatever
but it actually doesn't really do too
much to make the song feel like it's
it's moving in a direction the track
actually feels kind of cyclical kind of
like a I don't know like a like a bit of
a musical purgatory like you're stuck in

then by the time the drums really kick

body reaches a level of like animalistic
insanity I
haven't even heard them approach on

just kind of throwing [ __ ] at the wall

Punk is just really about break neck

there are some tracks on the track

noisy
cacophonous in the moment intensity they

it feels like dope body they're trying

this song is creepy as hell one of the

while
whereas muddy dune or Ash toke feel more

been
much more interesting if there was only

sometimes that that doesn't happen

ideas but they're still kind of exciting

is definitely an example of that I mean
not only is the guitar riff on this

and it just has this heavy this
lumbering groove that plays throughout

vocals and the the really just hard
aggressive drumming on this track it
makes the song hilariously ugly like
it's just so garish I just puts a smile

sounds very few bands kind of go into

of notion of experimenting and just
being like you know [ __ ] it whatever
happens sort of happens and in this
record really puts that feeling forward
it's entertaining in its most aggressive
and high-volume moments and it's pretty
entertaining as well during some of the

which might kind of feel like a very
easygoing kind of aloof quiet little
rock tune but it's it's actually pretty
sweet and enjoyable for what it is I
think this record is good it's very good
it's very interesting to hear a band
like dope body put themselves in a risky

was longer you know for as experimental
and is out there as it is you'd think
that more stuff would have ended up on

of doing these improvisational
recordings doing these weird experiments
but then when it came time to finally

they were super critical and and super
discerning about what people actually

lot of what they ended up recording
wasn't worthy of making it onto the

with just merely a 33 minute album I
think what ended up here is cool I just

because I think the moments on this
